titleStmt.title: Variants of the t-Form for passive
titleStmt.author: Veronika Engler

sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the t-Form for passive ((i)tCvCvC) (value is the pattern and give the example)

revisionDesc.change: updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

cit.quote: the one that is going to be born

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The t-passive is only used when "C1 is phonetically too close to the generally preferred passive marker n-".

cit.quote: the car wants to be washed

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Retsö deduced his examples from Kampffmeyer's text, but he notes that the dialect of Fez is neither a n-passive nor a t-passive dialect, but that both forms occur; regarding the t passive the form tt+stem and t+stem is found
t-passive only with 4 radicals, n-passive with others
t-passive only if root starts with l m n r ṛ w or originally with hamza, n-passive for all other roots
a less common variant: nəžṛəḥ - passive with n-
